title: 8 lesser discussed potential trade deadline candidates that could make sense for Celtics
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Celtics unlikely to take major trades before deadline, per ESPN's Tim Bontemps and Brian Windhorst.
Boston interested in Nets center Nic Claxton, may require trading Anfernee Simons due to Claxton's $25.3 million salary.
Celtics exploring options for affordable big men, including Goga Bitadze from the Magic or Daniel Gafford from the Mavericks.

title: Something in the Way Fest 2026: Live updates from Roadrunner
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: The Something in the Way festival is hosted at Roadrunner Boston from Jan. 31 to Feb. 1, 2026.
Philadelphia band Her New Knife kicked off the festival, delivering a politically charged performance with their shoegaze sound.
Graham Hunt, a solo indie rock act, followed with a set that included commentary on international politics.

title: Why the Bruins practiced in a tent on Saturday in Florida
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Boston Bruins practiced in a climate-controlled tent at Raymond James Stadium to maintain ice integrity before an outdoor game.
The tent, supporting outdoor rink conditions in Florida, measured 34 feet high, 125 feet wide, and 240 feet long.
Sunday's game in Tampa will occur in unusually low temperatures for Florida, around 30 degrees at puck drop.

title: Boston ‘ICE Out Everywhere’ protest must-see moments
author: Annie Jonas and Samantha Genzer
bullets: Thousands protested on Boston Common against ICE collaboration, advocating for immigrant protections and ending state cooperation with U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement.
The protest was organized by local groups and aligned with the 'National Shutdown' across 300 cities, spurred by recent ICE-related deaths.
Protesters highlighted historical parallels to 1930s Germany and called for local action from Gov. Healey and Massachusetts legislature.

title: Photos from Boston’s ‘ICE Out Everywhere’ protest
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Over a thousand people gathered at Boston Common to protest against President Donald Trumpâ€™s immigration policies despite harsh weather.
The 'ICE Out Everywhere' protest on January 31 was organized by Mass 50501 and other local groups.
The event was part of a series of nationwide protests following a 'National Shutdown' aimed at immigration policies.

title: Insider believes Red Sox have ‘another move in them’ this offseason to improve infield
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Red Sox are considering trading for a new infielder before the 2026 season begins.
ESPN's Jeff Passan suggests Isaac Paredes and Christian Walker are potential targets for the Red Sox.
Red Sox could make Marcelo Mayer their full-time third baseman with Romy Gonzalez and David Hamilton at second.

title: Even Drake Maye’s dad is surprised by Patriots’ Super Bowl run
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The New England Patriots reached Super Bowl LX after a 14-3 season following consecutive 4-13 records.
Quarterback Drake Maye led the Patriots' turnaround, achieving 4,394 passing yards and 31 touchdowns during the regular season.
Drake Maye's father, Mark Maye, expressed surprise at the Patriots' Super Bowl run, citing their challenging postseason performance.

title: That guy on TV, Cris Collinsworth, will look familiar to Patriots fans tuning into NBC to watch the Super Bowl
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Cris Collinsworth will call Super Bowl LX featuring the Patriots and Seahawks for NBC alongside Mike Tirico.
Collinsworth has broadcasted five Super Bowls with the Patriots, including their previous matchup with the Seahawks.
Collinsworth praised the Patriots' versatility in winning games through varying strategies, comparing it to their past dynasty years.

title: Mass. snowplow driver who spotted legs sticking out of snowbank praised for saving older man
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts snowplow driver Matte McGarry rescued an older man trapped in a snowbank during a snowstorm in Auburn.
The man fell headfirst into a three-foot-deep snowbank after watching a Patriots game and was unable to free himself.
McGarry will receive a commendation from the Auburn Board of Selectmen for his life-saving actions.

title: UMass student suspended after organizing protest sues university
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: UMass Amherst suspended student Kivlighan de Montebello for a year after he organized a protest against RTX at a career fair.
De Montebello's lawsuit claims his suspension violates First Amendment rights, arguing the protest didn't disrupt university operations.
The lawsuit seeks a jury trial, damages, and removal of the suspension from de Montebello's record, filed in Hampshire Superior Court.
